Poll findings: Most polls have found between 50% and 70% of Americans willing to get vaccinated, which falls below the desired level for complete eradication of the coronavirus.
Historical evidence: Experts believe that concerted educational efforts and a smooth rollout with early recipients can increase comfort and willingness to get vaccinated.
Expert opinion: Experts expressed disappointment with the low willingness of Americans to take the vaccine, particularly among racial minorities, but they emphasized that these early findings do not indicate failure.
Potential for change: With the availability of several vaccines and targeted educational efforts, experts expect Americans to become more comfortable with taking the vaccine.
